meanings.definition: To express disapproval of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She was criticizing the new movie for being boring.
meanings.sent2: He spent the entire meeting criticizing every idea presented.
meanings.sent3: The cat was criticizing the empty food bowl, demanding to be fed.
meanings.sent4: Her constant criticizing was like a dark cloud over their friendship.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's harsh criticizing made the students afraid to speak up.

meanings.definition: To analyze and evaluate the merits and faults of something.
meanings.sent1: The scientist was criticizing the data to ensure its accuracy.
meanings.sent2: It is important to have a balanced approach when criticizing a research paper.
meanings.sent3: The robot was criticizing the chess moves with lightning speed.
meanings.sent4: Critiquing a painting is like criticizing a symphony of colors and shapes.
meanings.sent5: Her methodical criticizing revealed hidden patterns in the design.

meanings.definition: To find fault with or point out flaws in something.
meanings.sent1: He kept criticizing the plan without offering any solutions.
meanings.sent2: She was always quick to start criticizing any new technology.
meanings.sent3: The toddler was criticizing the broken toy with a puzzled expression.
meanings.sent4: His constant criticizing of her work made her doubt her abilities.
meanings.sent5: The detective's keen eye for criticizing details solved the case.
